result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lewis Linsy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine of $250.00, costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by the probation agent.  Any remaining balance upon release of probation shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.

No alcohol.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any firearms or ammunition,  marijuana;  drug paraphernalia for personal use, delivery, manufacturing or distribution.
No possession al alcohol.
Comply with the paying DOC supervision fees.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Must attend at least one alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide a  DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

timeConds.notes:
Without goodtime, without any release privileges.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
  STAYED,  shall be imposed as follows for any violation of rules of probation: to serve 30 days for first violation; 45 days for second; 60 days for third.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Lewis Linsy in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case proceeds to Plea and Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT  1-
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND/OR EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least one Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
- Maintain fulltime work.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition. 
- No possession of any marijuana. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, delivery, manufacturing or distribution. 
- No possession of any alcohol.
- Court imposes and stays 135 days of condition time; without good time, without any release privileges. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time shall be imposed as follows: 
*30 days for a 1st violation of any rules of probation;
*45 days for a 2nd violation of any rules of probation;
*60 days for a 3rd violation of any rules of probation.
- Provide a DNA sample, if no already done. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. 
- Court orders a fine in the amount of $250.00, costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the probation agent. Any remaining balance upon release of probation shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
